nodes.description: Organizing events, actions, & collective mutual aid initiatives by and for the Brooklyn Transcore (BKTC) and associated communities

nodes.description: FxMA is a network of care formed to address our unhoused communities' immediate needs across the Fairfax neighborhood in Los Angeles.

nodes.description: We work in solidarity with our neighbors living unhoused in the South Bay of LA through mutual aid distro at encampments and other support.

nodes.name: Houston Regenerative Holistic Health Fund
nodes.description: We are a healthcare collaborative transforming the current sick-care paradigm of health into a holistic, regenerative, human-centered paradigm in body, mind, and spirit for the Greater Houston bioregions.

nodes.description: Harm Reduction

nodes.name: CROP LA
nodes.description: CROP-LA (Community Resilience Organizing Project) is a transportation justice and mutual aid group. We are providing free cycling safety gear and cyclistsâ€™ rights education in an increasingly bike-hostile city.

nodes.description: Neighbors helping neighbors in Ukrainian Village & West Town, Chicago.

nodes.description: Koinonia Mutual Aid is a network of care created by and for marginalized leaders serving in faith-based institutions.

nodes.name: Sacramento Food Not Bombs
nodes.description: We collect food that would otherwise go to waste and cook a vegan meal that we share with our community as a protest against poverty and war.

nodes.name: Nebula
nodes.description: Within prevention frameworks, we support survivors of battering, SA, IPV & DV with community & physical resources in crisis & in their empowerment; and we assist neighbors & mutual aid groups learn how to build liberatory practices in their groups.

nodes.name: Spring Garden Community Pantry
nodes.description: Free pantry providing mutual-aid in Philadelphia

nodes.name: EUJ Mutual Aid
nodes.description: We cook fresh hot meals and redistribute pantry food to community partners that are working directly with houseless or marginally housed community members. We started in March 2020. Currently each week we cook about 250 hot meals.

nodes.name: ChiResists - Chicago Solidarity Network
nodes.description: We offer frontline support, educational programming, cultural events and creative spaces to marginalized communities in Chicago.

nodes.name: South Philadelphia Community Fridge
nodes.description: We stock and maintain community fridges and pantries in the South Philadelphia neighborhood which provide access to food aid 24 hours a day.

nodes.name: Local Peace Economy
nodes.description: What will it take to end the violence and suffering in our world? We must radically reimagine and transform our relationships so they are defined by love, and compassion.

nodes.description: We host a monthly Resource Center for unhoused Angelenos in West LA. Email laneighbors4neighbors@gmail.com to get involved!

nodes.description: We (re)distribute food, household goods, hygiene products, camping gear, and more. All funds raised go towards purchasing crucial items that we can't source for free.

nodes.description: Share vegan meals and other items weekly in Tompkins Square Park.

nodes.name: SWOP Chi
nodes.description: Harm reduction supplies and resources for sex workers and their communities.

nodes.description: Worcester Community Fridges organizes a network of free food fridges through out Worcester, MA. We are a mutual aid collective working collaboratively towards food justice.

nodes.description: We curate, create and host free BIPOC centered Queer Pop-up events in the Hudson Valley, NY

nodes.description: We are an abolitionist network of care directly working with unhoused communities in Palms and neighboring areas.

nodes.description: We recover perfectly good food that's destined for landfills and deliver it to unhoused folks living in West LA instead. Email freefoodcollective@gmail.com to get involved.

nodes.description: Self-Directed Learning Community & Worker Cooperative

nodes.description: Organzing our neighbors and pooling our resources to create a better community for everyone.

nodes.description: PFP Mutual Aid works to meet survival needs and build shared understanding about why people do not have what they need.

nodes.name: Steel Fridge
nodes.description: Steel Fridge is a mutual aid organization providing access to food through community refrigerators across the Greater Pittsburgh area. Fueled by the communities we serve.

nodes.description: Chicago Tenants Movement is a collaborative network of tenant organizations and housing organizers from across the city working to keep our neighbors in their homes and build tenant power for the long haul.

nodes.name: Roslindale Food Collective
nodes.description: We rescue over 1,500 pounds of quality groceries every week. We distribute that food via a weekly free food program that feeds our direct community.

nodes.name: Drive by Howdy
nodes.description: Provide services for the unhoused. Help with food stamps, getting birth certificates, and medical services. Tents, food, clothing, and other essentials. The organization has helped to relocate, reestablish, and rehome people.

nodes.name: ViralBlackWorld:TheBronzevilleCommunityStore
nodes.description: One of ViralBlackWorld's survival programs serving as a free store that provides clothing/shoes, toiletries, groceries, household items, and community resources etc. to the community free of charge.

nodes.name: Circle City Mutual Aid
nodes.description: ccma shares free basic needs, survival, hygiene, + harm reduction items w/ the downtown Indianapolis community every Sunday, no questions asked

nodes.description: Our Community of Practice unapologetically centers our Quality of Life and livelihoods through Community Organizing, Mutual Aid and Holistic Wellness.

nodes.name: Libertarian Socialist Caucus
nodes.description: We are a collective that focuses on education (writing, training, and reading) around community engagement, mutual aid, direct action, tenant organizing, worker power, non-hierarchical decision-making, and the solidarity economy.

nodes.name: Power To The People
nodes.description: Storytelling for a regenerative futureâ€‡ðŸŒ±â€‡We produce longform media projects to uproot climate violence and uplift movements for collective liberation.

nodes.name: Community Kitchen MPLS
nodes.description: Community Kitchen makes, packs, and delivers hundreds of meals each week to unhoused neighbors. We're powered primarily by volunteers and food rescue, and we believe everybody deserves tasty and nutritious food. Join us: linktr.ee/communitykitchenmpls

nodes.name: West Side Mutual Aid
nodes.description: grocery delivery to Chicago's West side

nodes.name: ABQ Free Fridge
nodes.description: Abq Free Fridge is a mutual aid group working to place community refrigerators and pantries across the city.

nodes.name: Suburban Solidarity Network
nodes.description: Suburban Solidarity Network is a mutual aid network run completely by volunteers in the Northern Suburbs of Chicago. We are a collection of neighbors who believe in sharing our resources, skills, and strengths to benefit our community.

nodes.name: Distribute Aid USA
nodes.description: Distribute Aid is the world's largest mutual aid supply chain.  We power grassroots humanitarian aid movements at scale with open source tech and cutting-edge humanitarian logistics.

nodes.name: Stop The Sweeps ATX
nodes.description: Network dedicated to supporting those negatively impacted by sweeps of homeless encampments.

nodes.name: The Living Pantry
nodes.description: We distribute food, diapers, hygiene items and more to approximately 100 families at 1 p.m. every Monday at The Living Gallery, 1094 Broadway, Brooklyn, NY.

nodes.name: NWMA Coalition Chicago
nodes.description: A coalition of mutual aid networks representing various neighborhoods on the northwest side of Chicago sharing space at a warehouse facilitating many programs.

nodes.name: Socially Distant Art
nodes.description: Socially Distant Artists-in-Residence explore loneliness, social (dis)connection, solitude, and community bonds, while expanding their own knowledge of digital accessibility practices.

nodes.name: DiviDon
nodes.description: We built DiviDon to support hyper local initiatives with just one click. Currently sending support to 10 organizations across Texas and to support the work of organizations closer to our home-base in Brooklyn, NY as well.

nodes.name: FAVOR - Food Access Volunteers Of Roslindale
nodes.description: We are a volunteer-run mutual aid group fighting food insecurity in Roslindale and surrounding neighborhoods.

nodes.name: Hardship Solidarity Fund supporting NYU Student Workers
nodes.description: This mutual aid fund supports student workers who face economic hardship.

nodes.name: Minneapolis Quarry Community Mutual Aid
nodes.description: Group of Northeasters and beyond centered around the Quarry Community, providing one another with food, water, and other basic necessities.

nodes.name: Red Hook Mutual Aid
nodes.description: We are a small community network committed to making resources and information as accessible and inclusive as possible. We utilize a buddy system that serves as a safety net, ensuring everyone in Red Hook has what they need.

nodes.name: Hope Fridge
nodes.description: Hope Fridge provides, maintains, and keeps stocked working community fridges throughout the Fox Valley community because nobody should have to worry where their next meal is coming from.

nodes.name: Northside Chicago Prison Letter Writing Coalition
nodes.description: NC-PLWC is a solidarity network for mailing projects across walls & abolitionist community organizing. A subset of NC-PLWC is a mutual aid group that tables political education materials and does weekly resource distribution.

nodes.name: Evanston Fight for Black Lives
nodes.description: Evanston Fight for Black Lives is a youth, abolitionist organization that is dedicated to achieving justice for Black and Brown people within the Evanston community.

nodes.name: Downtown Brooklyn Boerum Hill Mutual Aid
nodes.description: Neighbors supporting neighbors in Brooklyn

nodes.name: Mutual Aid Books
nodes.description: We give out free books centering Black and Indigenous authors for readers of all ages. We distribute the books at pop ups, and in partnership with local mutual aid groups. Follow us on IG/Twitter @mutualaidbooks

nodes.name: Chicagoland Food Sovereignty Coalition
nodes.description: A coalition of autonomous mutual aid groups in Chicago and Cook County, working together to cultivate food sovereignty and autonomy for all people in all communities!

nodes.name: Rogers Park Free Store
nodes.description: A Free Store helping to facilitate mutual aid (goods, foods, clothing, etc.) to the Rogers Park and larger community

nodes.name: The Camila Foundation
nodes.description: Welcome to our donation page! We are a new, small nonprofit and deeply appreciate donations from our community and friends!

nodes.name: Love Wins Food Pantry
nodes.description: Love Wins Food Pantry is a queer-centric and volunteer-led effort to address food insecurity among our neighbors in Queens.  We distribute free food to hundreds of families every week. Find out more at www.lovewinsnyc.org.

nodes.name: Lakeview Lincoln Park Mutual Aid
nodes.description: We are a part of Chicago's network of mutual aid groups working to share resources, address needs, and build community with our neighbors.

nodes.name: Food Not Bombs Raleigh
nodes.description: Mutual aid distribution and community building. We provide clothes, toiletries, vegan food, and groceries, to anyone in need in Raleigh, NC and surrounding areas. We also seek to build & promote mutual aid projects & relationships.

nodes.name: Chicago Mutual Aid Build Squad
nodes.description: We bring together tools and people to build mutual aid projects across all Chicago communities

nodes.name: Denver Community Fridges
nodes.description: Denver Community Fridge is a mutual aid project where local businesses and community members drop off fresh food and meals to combat local food insecurity.

nodes.name: The Roslindale Community Fridge
nodes.description: The Roslindale Community Fridge is a mutual aid collective working to provide food access + resources to residents through community fridge efforts and community programming.

nodes.name: Solidaridad Inquilina - Tenant Solidarity
nodes.description: Build mutual support and defense among tenants in southwest Chicago.

nodes.name: Home is a Human Right
nodes.description: A conversation series featuring New Yorkers who have lived without a home or are at risk of losing one & other guests with big picture perspectives on this crisis. Donations fund honorariums for speakers with a small amount going to web and zoom hosting.

nodes.name: The Love Fridge
nodes.description: The Love Fridge is a Chicago mutual aid group grounded in food, working to place community refrigerators across the city. We are powered by kindness, generosity, love, and the belief that being able to feed yourself is a right, not a privilege.

nodes.name: Belmont-Cragin Mutual Aid
nodes.description: Organizing mutual aid in the Belmont-Cragin neighborhood of Chicago

nodes.name: The Moving Support Project
nodes.description: Securing and moving free furniture for formerly unhoused people: an initiative of Mutual Aid Housing Strategies (affiliate of Mutual Aid NYC).

nodes.name: Chicago Community Jail Support
nodes.description: Volunteer mutual aid network supporting those recently released from Cook County Jail.

nodes.name: Sunnyside & Woodside Mutual Aid
nodes.description: Sunnyside & Woodside Mutual Aid (SWMA) is a group of neighbors acting collectively to address community needs and take care of each other.

nodes.name: Little Read Books
nodes.description: A Denver mutual aid collective getting books and other important supplies in the hands of people who need and read them.

nodes.name: Comrade Co-op
nodes.description: Building community through mutual aid in Denver, with a focus on food equity and sustainability.

nodes.name: NYC Socialist RA
nodes.description: We're non-sectarian org, meaning no allegiance to any ideology. Our community only cares about building the interpersonal connections to create stronger more self sustained communities within NYC and surrounding areas.

nodes.name: Minneapolis Northside Mutual Aid
nodes.description: We are housed and unhoused neighbors supporting each other with masks, meals, heat, and hope during COVID-19 in North Minneapolis.

nodes.name: Gowanus Mutual Aid
nodes.description: We are a grassroots community collective based in Gowanus, Brooklyn. We are dedicated to supporting our neighbors throughout Gowanus and meeting the needs of those in need.

nodes.name: Supper Collective
nodes.description: We feed those fighting for change and the food insecure across New York.

nodes.name: Hermosa Mutual Aid
nodes.description: Hermosa residents working together to make food and necessary supplies accessible to our community during the COVID-19 pandemic.

nodes.name: Washington DC Ward 3 Mutual Aid Neighbor Support
nodes.description: Ward 3 Mutual Aid is part of a grassroots response to COVID-19 in Washington DC. We are a collective of neighbors helping neighbors & organizing to build a just and equitable city.

nodes.description: Support and relief to Irving Park neighbors in Chicago, responding to public health and economy crisis

nodes.name: Humboldt Park Solidarity Network
nodes.description: We're neighbors helping neighbors in the Humboldt Park neighborhood of Chicago.

nodes.name: ATX Mental Health Fund
nodes.description: We are a mutual aid fund that provides direct cash assistance to promote mental healthcare accessibility in Austin, Texas. https://www.atxmentalhealthfund.com/

nodes.name: Ward 2 Mutual Aid
nodes.description: Mutual aid organization helping neighbors in need during COVID-19 in Washington DC, Ward 2

nodes.name: Street Forum
nodes.description: Mutual aid for unhoused Austinites since 2019. Check us out on instagram @streetforumatx for updates on our current projects.

nodes.name: Club A Kitchen
nodes.description: Club A Kitchen is a mutual aid group that provides food, groceries, PPE and hygiene supplies to the community out of the Bushwick City Farm in Brooklyn, NY every Wednesday and Saturday from 1:30-3:30 p.m.

nodes.name: Chicago Mutual Aid Gardens
nodes.description: We build free, edible community gardens in front yards, parkways, and other publicly accessible spaces.

nodes.name: Keeling Mutual Aid
nodes.description: We help with groceries, hygiene/baby products and utility assistance to anyone in need in the Keeling neighborhood of Tucson, Arizona. View our expenses spreadsheet and receipts folder via links in the "about" section of this page. IG @keeling.mutual.aid

nodes.name: M4BL DC Money Pot
nodes.description: A resource sharing project, where people with access to resources contribute what they can, to a pool of funds, and organizers can draw from the pot to meet their needs.  Nominate an organizer at bit.ly/moneypot-nomination.

nodes.name: Edgewater Mutual Aid
nodes.description: We are a grassroots effort aiming to provide critical relief and engage in mutual aid practices with the Edgewater, Chicago community.

nodes.name: Bronzeville Kenwood Mutual Aid
nodes.description: We are a group of Bronzeville and Kenwood neighbors using mutual aid and exchange principles to build stronger communities in Chicago and beyond.

nodes.description: We are part of Chicago's mutual aid network of neighbors helping neighbors, working to share resources and build community across the city.

nodes.description: We provide mutual aid to our neighbors in Ridgewood, Maspeth, Glendale, and Middle Village in the form of food distribution, a community fridge, homeless outreach and eviction defense support.

nodes.name: Athens Mutual Aid Network
nodes.description: Solidarity not charity by and for resilient communities in Northeast Georgia

nodes.name: HMC Solidarity
nodes.description: A mutual aid fund for HMC students impacted by COVID-19

nodes.name: LeFrak City & Corona Mutual Aid Network
nodes.description: We are a Mutual Aid network based in Corona, Queens in New York City -epicenter of this pandemic. Aid provided 2 neighbors include grocery purchases & delivery.

nodes.name: Museum Workers Speak
nodes.description: We are activist museum workers interrogating the relationship between museumsâ€™ stated commitments to social value and their internal labor practices.

nodes.name: Ward 5 Mutual Aid
nodes.description: Volunteer organization helping neighbors in need during COVID-19.

nodes.name: West Brooklyn Waterfront Mutual Aid
nodes.description: We are a grassroots community collective based in Boerum Hill, Bk Heights, Carroll Gardens, Cobble Hill, Columbia Waterfront dedicated to supporting our neighbors throughout Brooklyn for the duration of the COVID 19 crisis.

nodes.name: Lesley University Mutual Aid
nodes.description: Welcome to LUMA, Lesley University Mutual Aid! In these challenging times, we are committed to showing up for each other in solidarity. Join us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/152926309494154

nodes.name: Logan Square Mutual Aid
nodes.description: Supporting our community through mutual aid

nodes.description: We connect individuals in North Brooklyn affected by the Covid-19 pandemic to organizations and volunteers in the Greenpoint and Williamsburg areas

nodes.name: East Bronx Dems Mutual Aid Group
nodes.description: The Grocery Gift Card fundraiser was organized by the East Bronx Democrats, a group of individuals who came together to participate actively in the community affairs of the East Bronx and to attempt to further the concerns of all its residents.

nodes.description: A network of Bushwick neighbors supporting neighbors. Una red de vecines de Bushwick apoyando vecines. Volunteer: https://bit.ly/BAM-sign-up Request: https://bit.ly/BAMrequest

nodes.name: sf community support
nodes.description: a grass-roots effort coordinating safe actions to meet the most pressing needs in our neighborhoods through COVID 19 and beyond

nodes.name: Utah Valley Mutual Aid
nodes.description: Organizing resources & support for our communities.

nodes.name: Rocky Mountain Mutual Aid Network (RMMAN)
nodes.description: RMMAN began operating in 2020 in response to a need in our community during the pandemic. In partnership with a local food rescue, Joyâ€™s Kitchen, our volunteers deliver groceries to approximately 15-20 households across the Denver metro every week.
